review_title: Very Excellent Overview of Mars Mission
one_reviews_text:
Inspirational , Dr. Aldrin quickly explains the concept of a perpetual cycling shuttle system to support multiple missions to Mars. Excellent use of VR to set the presentation stage.

Advise to ignore the sad little ignorant trolls sending negative reviews

Firstly I was sitting when loading this, but upon seeing Buzz stood in front of me I felt compelled to stand. It was a treat to be opposite such a pioneer and look him in the eye, albeit virtually. I really appreciated that and would love to see more with the likes of Sir David Attenborough etc. It's another marvel of VR where we can meet our heroes.

The experience lasts maybe 10 minutes, I found it fairly inspiring but I don't need persuasion for us to colonise the solar system, for educators able to share this experience with their learners it's almost silly not to.

A 5 star review system is limited, and I'm a tough critic, but for what this is, and it being free, I will give it 5/5. I can only hope this is just a taste of things to come.
Was super informative, fun and on top of it FREE.  Buzz seems like a smart and cool guy.  Thanks devs for making something like this.  Keep 'em coming.

review_title: More power to Buzz and the trip to Mars
one_reviews_text:
I can't help but smile as I watch Mr. Aldrin still show the same awe and excitement I had at six years old when my dad let me stay home from school to watch the launching and landings in 1969.

His idea for colonizing Mars is presented simply enough for the layman and interesting enough for those of us who have more than a keen eye on this upcoming era of exploration.

For me, everything flowed smoothly, with zero glitches.  For those who complained about Buzz appearing to high on the screen, you do know you can reset the view right?

review_title: What a time to be alive!
one_reviews_text:
He was born Edwin Eugene, but he loved to be called Buzz. So he made it his first legal name by 1988. Even though if we should pick a date that marked his long career, that would be 1969. July 21st to be precise, at 03:15:16 UTC. When he became the second human being to set foot on the Moon.
Today I met Dr. Aldrin, not in person of course, but through this amazing VR experience, called Cycling Pathways to Mars, that shows exactly what virtual reality was made for. It was made by dreamers, for dreamers!
I know I come late to this, but I'm wondering why this wasn't talked out loud! It's a primer in holographic VR. And it's wonderfully inspiring. As much as an 88 years old - who's not tired of exploring the bounds of space - can be, when dealing with his own dreams.
He's a visionary. And an engineer. Even though he addresses himself as "someone who will be remembered for just kicking some moondust". But his idea for traveling to Mars, albeit seeming scifi-ish, it's worth being experienced first hand, through this free VR experience. Cause watching a trailer can hardly convey the sense of awe when watching the Cycler cruise over your head!
I pray for the impossible to become possible
Good video, did not set up correctly, Buzz was standing slightly above me. Over all not the worst, not the best app. but enjoyable none the least.

I wanted to like this title but this is the most glitchy, horrible, unpolished experience I've EVER had on oculus.  I have played content on both Steam and Oculus and this is the ONLY title I've ever gotten that simply does not work well AT all.

review_title: What you need is a rocket experience
one_reviews_text:
Hehe, Buzz "I do anything for  a buck or two" Aldrin is fittingly portrayed as the ghost of the man he once was, a walking stiff
Just one of his many money grabbing schemes

We won't go to the moon an we will neither go to Mars, just ain't gonna happen, for one the Martian soil is not rich enough in nutrients for food to grow in
They'd have to import tons of minerals, stuff like phosphorus and potassium to at least make the sterile soil of the dea.... uhr red planet yield any crops at all.

About the presentation, Buzz is kinda hipping and hopping on his feet as if he could burst into rapping about the "rocket experience" in this reviews' title
He actually  made a rap with Snoop dog, really, here take a look https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRI6BghJ1PU

What more proof does one  need that Buzz does anything... I said anyy thiiing for a couple of bucks (just like Mary in Joe's garage)

Pretty much a boring uninspiring video
for those of you who likes science museum as kids, this will be the immersive inspirational science class you are looking for
It would have worked just as well in a 2D video

I look forward to more VR content of interesting ideas, documentaries, and displays of technology. This is interesting and fun to watch. The holographic Buzz Aldrin is a little wonky, but it's ok. The Mars plan though, it's just silly. Why is it better to send the first humans to Io first? Poor Buzz only has ideas and no tech. The cycler plan will never happen, but it is neat to see the proposal.
A great introduction to the mars missions, explaining complex things in a simple and effective way using lifesize realistic props!
the entire exspirence was amazing from how it shows the amazing ideas of life on mars and the graphics and way of inspiring and teaching this idea

Great idea and presentation, especially the 3D model of Buzz Aldrin - at first I thought it must be video, until I realized when I move my head I can see him from different directions - but also the environments.

review_title: Who new Buzz Lightyear was a real person
one_reviews_text: ... a real old person with a wacky plan to colonize Mars?  ;)
Interesting video. Environment is a little wonky - knees in floor. Buzz isn't properly angled either, making him look past you a bit.
A very isprational speech from one of americas greatest heros well worth downloading.

Summarizing: Presentation 6 out of 10, Content 2 out of 10. As an avid space fan i felt i just had to see this. I have huge respect for dr Aldrin, and therefore i feel i must leave an honest review. It was an... interesting experience. The graphics are quite nicely done but on the content front it just lacks punch. My main gripe is with the content. It is never explained what the proposed spacecraft exactly do, why it is such an "efficient way to travel" and why there are even called cyclers (other than resembling a wheel i suppose?) There are a few scientific flaws in the presentation (like seeing stars from moon surface)  and mr aldrins eyes look unnatural. As if added in postproduction or something. Judging by the discription i supposed this would give me insight in mr aldrin's plan for going to mars, but it did not. On the positive side, this experience shows the enormous potential for educational purposes. If you are a space fan like me, thirsty for knowledge i can recommend Apollo 11. IT.IS.BRILLIANT.

This is an interesting short experience that is much better than a 3D 360 degree video would have been. Using supersampling (as I always do), I was also pleased with the graphical quality, once I had maxed out the included settings options. I would like to see a longer, more in-depth version, and I would love to see this kind of content from the likes of NASA and SpaceX as well.

review_title: Would be really cool if it worked
one_reviews_text: Have got this to work only once or twice. Super buggy, actually caused a BSOD, first time in years that I've seen one of those...
A very nice quick overview on Aldrin's project to establish a human colony on Mars.

Compared to the new VR experiences, this thing sucks. Buzz's eyes are super weird, and he talks. to. slowly. and basically. The plan is already old. SpaceX is gonna destroy this idea. So, while cool, good for kids maybe. The graphics are old, and not smooth transitions.
VR gaming may be falling flat, but communication, science, and general education become more transparent and effective using these channels.
Crashed the first run but second time was the charm. Some good visual effects. A shame the platform you're on can't be hidden as that detracted from several of the spaceborne shots.

For about 10 minutes, this app lets you experience a VR presentation about Dr. Buzz Aldrin's crazy idea to go from Earth to the Moon to Phobos to Mars using spaceships he designed. He gave a few reasons for wanting to carry out this plan, but nothing very convincing, as if becoming a multi-planetary species was an end in itself rather than a means to some other end. The audio/visual quality is top notch. Clearly many talented people were involved in creating the art and design of the experience. If you can spare the time to download this hefty app, you should definitely check it out!

I absolutely enjoyed this video, the idea, the whole composition was really breathtaking. It's not about how, or why, or even if it's possible, it's about making possible history or future, with some really nice rendering, and a great storyline. P.S The universe is beautiful, i suggest giving it a watch with an open mind :)
I have a hard time believing we will be going to Mars anytime soon when we can't even establish a moon base or keep the space shuttle program going, but this was an intriguing experience anyway.

Besides that it lacks any depth and has all kind of technical and other issues and just feels very unpolished. The credits feel longer than the rest of the experience...
Per default, the settings are on minimum, which means a lot of aliasing and no shadows.

Well, it's nice to have Buzz Aldrin in person talking to you about science fiction (or vision), but basically that's all you get here. A sort of 3d movie, a few minutes long, a vision without any technical details and without any interaction. It's for free, so if you want to spend 10 to 15 minutes, go for it. Don't expect too much.

Looking forward to seeing more on Buzz Aldrin's plan. 

Also, it's a wonderful showcase of these developers' VR presentation tool kits. It's exciting to see the work that's going on in this space!
